meanings.definition: To make too strong an impression on someone.
meanings.sent1: The magician's tricks did not overimpress the skeptical audience.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to overimpress her new friends with her knowledge.
meanings.sent3: Trying to overimpress can sometimes backfire and make you seem insincere.
meanings.sent4: His extravagant gestures to overimpress his boss only made him look desperate.
meanings.sent5: It's better to be genuine than to overimpress with false bravado.

meanings.definition: To impress too strongly or too much.
meanings.sent1: The bright colors of the painting seemed to overimpress the young child.
meanings.sent2: He didn't want to overimpress his date with expensive gifts.
meanings.sent3: His attempts to overimpress his crush with fancy dinners were endearing but unnecessary.
meanings.sent4: The grandeur of the palace never failed to overimpress visitors from far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display was designed to overimpress the spectators and leave them in awe.
